story.text: FRANKFURT Jan 3 Audi (NSUG.DE), the premium-car division of Volkswagen (VOWG.DE), saw a 34.6-percent rise in vehicle sales in the United States in December, taking its 2006 sales to a record 90,116 cars, it said on Wednesday. Audi said in a statement it sold 11,897 vehicles in the United States in December. Over the full year 2006, its U.S. vehicle sales rose 8.5 percent. Johan de Nysschen, Audi of America's executive vice president, said: "2007 looks to be just as exciting." "Several dealers will complete Audi-exclusive dealerships and we'll launch several highly anticipated vehicles, including the R8, TT, and A5 models," he added in the statement.
story.title: vw ' s audi says u . s . december sales rose 34 . 6 pct
